alert.note: Alert for Lincoln County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 15 at 11:40AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .High monsoonal moisture over the region will result in afternoon thunderstorms that could produce very heavy rainfall, especially in high terrain areas of east-central and southern Nevada. Rainfall rates of over 1 inch per hour could result from these thunderstorms in these locations. Lower elevation areas will also see thunderstorms today but flash flood risk is expected to be more marginal in nature. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall in thunderstorms is possible. * WHERE...Lincoln County in south-central Nevada. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Heavy rainfall in high terrain areas could rapidly result in flowing flood waters in lower lying areas such as slot canyons and valley washes. Strong gusty winds over 50 mph will also be possible with these thunderstorms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor for the issuance of Flash Flood Warnings this afternoon and evening and be prepared to take action should they be issued.
